title: powers conferred on me by section 3 of the European Communities Act 1972
heading: 1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as
text_raw:
1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as 

the European Union 
(International Labour Organisation Work in Fishing Convention) (Food and 
Accommodation) Regulations 2020. 

(2) These Regulations shall come into operation on 2nd August 2020. 

Interpretation
text_norm: 1 (1) regulation may cited european union (international labour organisation work fishing convention) (food accommodation) regulation 2020 (2) regulation shall come operation 2nd august 2020 interpretation

title: powers conferred on me by section 3 of the European Communities Act 1972
heading: 2. (1) In these Regulations -
text_raw:
2. (1) In these Regulations - 

“authorised officer” shall be construed in accordance with Regulation 
50(1); 

“competent authority” means the body designated as the competent 
authority under Regulation 5; 

“decked vessel” means a fishing vessel - 

(a) having a fixed structural deck covering the entire hull above 

the deepest operating waterline, and 

(b) 

which, if fitted with any open well or cockpit in the deck 
referred to in paragraph (a), that open well or cockpit, if 
flooded, does not endanger the fishing vessel; 

“direction” has the meaning assigned to it by Regulation 52(1); 

1 OJ No. L 25, 31.1.2017, p.12 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 31st July, 2020. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [267] 3 

“Directive” means Council Directive (EU) 2017/159 of 19 December 
20161 implementing the Agreement concerning the implementation of 
the Work in Fishing Convention, 2007 of the International Labour 
Organisation, concluded on 21 May 2012 between the General 
Confederation of Agricultural Cooperatives in the European Union 
(Cogeca), the European Transport Workers’ Federation (ETF) and the 
Association of National Organisations of Fishing Enterprises in the 
European Union (Europêche); 

“existing vessel” means a fishing vessel that is not a new fishing vessel; 

“fisherman” means a person who works in any capacity under a 
contract of employment or in an employment relationship on board a 
fishing vessel, including any other person engaged in activities related 
to fishing who is present on the same vessel in order to protect the 
overall health and safety of the persons on board, but does not include - 

(a) 

(b) 

a person who is a pilot within the meaning of the Harbours 
Act 1996 (No. 11 of 1996), or 

a shore person carrying out work on board a fishing vessel 
at the quay side; 

“fisherman’s work agreement” means a contract of employment or 
other similar arrangement, or any other contract governing a 
fisherman’s living and working conditions on board a fishing vessel; 

“fishing vessel” means any ship or boat registered in the State, of any 
nature whatsoever, irrespective of the form of ownership, used or 
intended to be used for the purpose of commercial fishing; 

"length” means 96 per cent of the total length on a waterline at 85 per 
cent of the least depth, or the length from the foreside of the stem to the 
axis of the rudder stock on that waterline, if that length is greater. In 
vessels designed with a rake of keel the waterline on which this length 
is measured shall be parallel to the designed waterline; 

“master” means the fisherman having command of a fishing vessel; 

“Minister” means the Minister for Transport, Tourism and Sport; 

“new fishing vessel” means a decked vessel for which - 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [267] 

(a) 

(b) 

the building or major conversion contract has been placed 
on or after 16 November 2017, 

the building or major conversion contract has been placed 
before 16 November 2017 and which is delivered three 
years or more after that date; or 

(c) 

in the absence of a building contract, on or after 16 
November 2017 - 

(i) 

the keel is laid, 

(ii) 

construction identifiable with a specific vessel begins, 
or 

(iii) assembly has commenced comprising at least 50 
tonnes or one per cent of the estimated mass of all 
structural material, whichever is less; 

“notice of detention” has the meaning assigned to it by Regulation 
51(2); 

“officer” means a fisherman who is designated as an officer in the safe 
manning document issued to the owner of the fishing vessel by the 
competent authority; 

“owner” means the owner of a fishing vessel or any other organisation 
or person, such as the manager, agent or charterer, who has assumed 
responsibility for the operation of the fishing vessel from the owner; 

“Regulations of 1999” means the Safety, Health and Welfare at Work 
(Fishing Vessels) Regulations, 1999 (S.I. No. 325 of 1999); 

“Regulations of 2007” means the Merchant Shipping (Safety of Fishing 
Vessels) (15-24 Metres) Regulations 2007 (S.I. No. 640 of 2007). 

to “adequate”, “appropriate” or “suitable”, 

(2) Unless the context otherwise requires, where reference is made in these 
to 
Regulations 
accommodation requirements, the accommodation, equipment or fitting 
referred to shall be deemed to be adequate, appropriate or suitable, as the case 
may be - 

in relation 

(a) 

if it is in compliance with standards or specifications that have 
been formulated or recommended by the National Standards 
Authority of Ireland and are applied by the competent authority 
having regard to the size of the fishing vessel, the number of 
fishermen on board, and the nature and duration of the voyage, 
or 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [267] 5 

(b) 

if, in respect of equipment that is marine equipment falling 
within the scope of the European Union (Marine Equipment) 
Regulations 2017 (S.I. No. 177 of 2017), the equipment is in 
compliance with the requirements of those Regulations. 

(3) A word or expression that is used in these Regulations and is also used 
in the Directive has, unless the context otherwise requires, the same meaning in 
these Regulations as it has in the Directive. 

Application

(a) (b) person pilot within meaning harbour act 1996 (no 11 1996) shore person carrying work board fishing vessel quay side fisherman work agreement mean contract employment similar arrangement contract governing fisherman living working condition board fishing vessel fishing vessel mean ship boat registered state nature whatsoever irrespective form ownership used intended used purpose commercial fishing length mean 96 per cent total length waterline 85 per cent least depth length foreside stem axis rudder stock waterline length greater vessel designed rake keel waterline length measured shall parallel designed waterline master mean fisherman command fishing vessel minister mean minister transport tourism sport new fishing vessel mean decked vessel - 4 267 (a) (b) building major conversion contract placed 16 november 2017 building major conversion contract placed 16 november 2017 delivered three year date (c) absence building contract 16 november 2017 - (i) keel laid (ii) construction identifiable specific vessel begin (iii) assembly commenced comprising least 50 tonne one per cent estimated mass structural material whichever le notice detention meaning assigned regulation 51(2) officer mean fisherman designated officer safe manning document issued owner fishing vessel competent authority owner mean owner fishing vessel organisation person manager agent charterer assumed responsibility operation fishing vessel owner regulation 1999 mean safety health welfare work (fishing vessels) regulation 1999 (s.i no 325 1999) regulation 2007 mean merchant shipping (safety fishing vessels) (15-24 metres) regulation 2007 (s.i no 640 2007) adequate appropriate suitable (2) unless context otherwise requires reference made regulation accommodation requirement accommodation equipment fitting referred shall deemed adequate appropriate suitable case may - relation (a) compliance standard specification formulated recommended national standard authority ireland applied competent authority regard size fishing vessel number fisherman board nature duration voyage 267 5 (b) respect equipment marine equipment falling within scope european union (marine equipment) regulation 2017 (s.i no 177 2017) equipment compliance requirement regulation (3) word expression used regulation also used directive unless context otherwise requires meaning regulation directive application

title: powers conferred on me by section 3 of the European Communities Act 1972
heading: 5. That part of the Department of Transport, Tourism and Sport which is
text_raw:
5. That part of the Department of Transport, Tourism and Sport which is 
known as the Marine Survey Office is designated as the competent authority in 
the State for the purposes of Articles 21, 22, 23, 24 and 25 and Annex II of the 
Annex to the Directive, and Article 3 of the Directive (in so far as that Article 
relates to those provisions) and these Regulations. 

Maintenance of accommodation

title: powers conferred on me by section 3 of the European Communities Act 1972
heading: 6. The master shall ensure that the accommodation on board the fishing
text_raw:
6. The master shall ensure that the accommodation on board the fishing 
vessel is maintained in a hygienic, safe, healthy and comfortable condition 
appropriate to the service of the vessel and the length of time the fishermen live 
on board. 

Feeder vessels
text_norm: 6 master shall ensure accommodation board fishing vessel maintained hygienic safe healthy comfortable condition appropriate service vessel length time fisherman live board feeder vessel

title: powers conferred on me by section 3 of the European Communities Act 1972
heading: 7. (1) In this Regulation, “feeder vessel” means a vessel which is launched
text_raw:
7. (1) In this Regulation, “feeder vessel” means a vessel which is launched 

from, and recovered to, a mother fishing vessel. 

(2) Where a feeder vessel does not have appropriate accommodation and 
sanitary facilities on board the vessel, the owner of the mother fishing vessel 
shall ensure that a fisherman on the feeder vessel is provided with 
accommodation and sanitary facilities on board the mother fishing vessel. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 6 [267] 

PART 2 

Food and Drinking Water 

Provision of food and drinking water
text_norm: 7 (1) regulation feeder vessel mean vessel launched recovered mother fishing vessel (2) feeder vessel appropriate accommodation sanitary facility board vessel owner mother fishing vessel shall ensure fisherman feeder vessel provided accommodation sanitary facility board mother fishing vessel 6 267 part 2 food drinking water provision food drinking water

title: powers conferred on me by section 3 of the European Communities Act 1972
heading: 8. (1) The master shall ensure that -
text_raw:
8. (1) The master shall ensure that - 

(a) 

the food carried and served on board the fishing vessel shall be 
of suitable nutritional value, and of sufficient quality and 
quantity having regard to - 

(i) 

the number of fishermen on board, 

(ii) 

the nature and duration of the voyage, and 

the religious requirements and cultural practices of the 
fishermen on board in relation to food, 

(iii) 

and 

(b) 

the drinking water provided on board the fishing vessel shall be 
of sufficient quality and quantity having regard to the number of 
fishermen on board the vessel and the nature and duration of the 
voyage. 

(2) The owner shall, subject to paragraph (3), provide food and water on 

board at no cost to a fisherman. 

(3) The cost of providing food and water on board may be recovered by the 
owner from a fisherman as an operational cost where this is provided for in a 
collective agreement governing a share system of the fisherman concerned or 
in the fisherman’s work agreement. 

Sleeping rooms-existing vessels of 24 metres in length and over 

PART 3
text_norm: 8 (1) master shall ensure - (a) food carried served board fishing vessel shall suitable nutritional value sufficient quality quantity regard - (i) number fisherman board (ii) nature duration voyage religious requirement cultural practice fisherman board relation food (iii) (b) drinking water provided board fishing vessel shall sufficient quality quantity regard number fisherman board vessel nature duration voyage (2) owner shall subject paragraph (3) provide food water board cost fisherman (3) cost providing food water board may recovered owner fisherman operational cost provided collective agreement governing share system fisherman concerned fisherman work agreement sleeping rooms-existing vessel 24 metre length part 3

title: powers conferred on me by section 3 of the European Communities Act 1972
heading: 9. The owner of an existing vessel of 24 metres in length and over shall
text_raw:
9. The owner of an existing vessel of 24 metres in length and over shall 
ensure that not later than two years after the coming into operation of these 
Regulations the sleeping rooms in the fishing vessel meet the following 
requirements: 

(a) 

sleeping rooms shall be - 

(i) 

of sufficient size and quality and appropriately equipped 
for the service of the vessel and the length of time 
fishermen live on board, and 

(ii) 

so planned and equipped as to ensure reasonable comfort 
for the occupants and to facilitate tidiness, 

(b) 

equipment to be provided in sleeping rooms shall include berths 
and individual lockers that are of sufficient size for putting 
clothing and other personal effects, 

 
 
 
 
 [267] 7 

(c) 

the maximum number of persons to be accommodated in any 
sleeping room shall be legibly and indelibly marked in a place in 
the room where it can be conveniently seen, 

(d) mattresses shall be of a suitable material, and 

(e) 

local lighting shall be provided in each berth. 

Accommodation-decked vessels of 15 metres in length overall (Loa) and 
over but less than 24 metres in length 

PART 4 

Application-Part 4
text_norm: 9 owner existing vessel 24 metre length shall ensure later two year coming operation regulation sleeping room fishing vessel meet following requirement (a) sleeping room shall - (i) sufficient size quality appropriately equipped service vessel length time fisherman live board (ii) planned equipped ensure reasonable comfort occupant facilitate tidiness (b) equipment provided sleeping room shall include berth individual locker sufficient size putting clothing personal effect 267 7 (c) maximum number person accommodated sleeping room shall legibly indelibly marked place room conveniently seen (d) mattress shall suitable material (e) local lighting shall provided berth accommodation-decked vessel 15 metre length overall (loa) le 24 metre length part 4 application-part 4

title: powers conferred on me by section 3 of the European Communities Act 1972
heading: 10. (1) This Part applies to -
text_raw:
10. (1) This Part applies to - 

(a) 

(b) 

a new fishing vessel of 15 metres in length overall (Loa) and 
over but less than 24 metres in length, and 

an existing decked vessel of 15 metres in length overall (Loa) 
and over but less than 24 metres in length where the 
accommodation is substantially altered or reconstructed on or 
after 16 November 2017. 

(2) In this Regulation, “length overall (Loa)” means the length measured in 
a straight line from the fore part of the stem at top to the aftermost tide of the 
transom or stern contour. 

Change in flag of vessel

(b)

the accommodation on the fishing vessel shall, where reasonable and 
practicable, meet the requirements of this Part.

title: powers conferred on me by section 3 of the European Communities Act 1972
heading: 14. Sufficient drainage shall be provided in accommodation spaces.
text_raw:
14. Sufficient drainage shall be provided in accommodation spaces. 

Ventilation and lighting
text_norm: 14 sufficient drainage shall provided accommodation space ventilation lighting

title: powers conferred on me by section 3 of the European Communities Act 1972
heading: 15. (1) Ventilation arrangements or other measures shall be such as to
text_raw:
15. (1) Ventilation arrangements or other measures shall be such as to 

protect non-smokers from tobacco smoke. 

(2) Where sleeping spaces have natural light, a means of blocking light 

shall be provided. 

(3) Adequate reading light shall be provided for every berth in addition to 

the normal lighting of the sleeping room. 

(4) Emergency lighting shall be provided in sleeping rooms. 

(5) Where the fishing vessel is not fitted with emergency lighting in mess 
rooms, passageways, and any other spaces that are or may be used for 
emergency escape, permanent night lighting shall be provided in such spaces. 

Sleeping rooms
text_norm: 15 (1) ventilation arrangement measure shall protect non-smokers tobacco smoke (2) sleeping space natural light mean blocking light shall provided (3) adequate reading light shall provided every berth addition normal lighting sleeping room (4) emergency lighting shall provided sleeping room (5) fishing vessel fitted emergency lighting mess room passageway space may used emergency escape permanent night lighting shall provided space sleeping room

title: powers conferred on me by section 3 of the European Communities Act 1972
heading: 16. (1) The number of persons allowed to occupy each sleeping room shall
text_raw:
16. (1) The number of persons allowed to occupy each sleeping room shall 

not be more than six. 

(2) A separate sleeping room or sleeping rooms shall be provided for 

officers, wherever practicable. 

(3) Local lighting shall be provided in each berth. 

(4) Sleeping accommodation shall be situated or equipped, as practicable, 

so as to provide appropriate levels of privacy for men and women. 

Mess rooms
text_norm: 16 (1) number person allowed occupy sleeping room shall six (2) separate sleeping room sleeping room shall provided officer wherever practicable (3) local lighting shall provided berth (4) sleeping accommodation shall situated equipped practicable provide appropriate level privacy men woman mess room

title: powers conferred on me by section 3 of the European Communities Act 1972
heading: 17. (1) Mess rooms shall in no case be located forward of the collision
text_raw:
17. (1) Mess rooms shall in no case be located forward of the collision 

bulkhead. 

(2) Facilities for making hot and cold drinks shall be available and 

accessible to fishermen at all times. 

Sanitary facilities
text_norm: 17 (1) mess room shall case located forward collision bulkhead (2) facility making hot cold drink shall available accessible fisherman time sanitary facility

title: powers conferred on me by section 3 of the European Communities Act 1972
heading: 18. (1) Sanitary facilities shall allow for reasonable privacy.
text_raw:
18. (1) Sanitary facilities shall allow for reasonable privacy. 

(2) Floors in sanitary accommodation shall have a non-slip deck covering. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 [267] 9 

Bedding, mess utensils and miscellaneous provisions
text_norm: 18 (1) sanitary facility shall allow reasonable privacy (2) floor sanitary accommodation shall non-slip deck covering 267 9 bedding mess utensil miscellaneous provision

title: powers conferred on me by section 3 of the European Communities Act 1972
heading: 19. (1) Eating utensils, bedding and other linen that are of sufficient
text_raw:
19. (1) Eating utensils, bedding and other linen that are of sufficient 

quantity, quality and cleanliness shall be provided to all fishermen on board. 

(2) The cost of linen (other than bedding) may be recovered by the owner 
from a fisherman as an operational cost where this is provided for in a 
collective agreement governing the share system of the fisherman concerned or 
in the fisherman’s work agreement. 

Communication facilities
text_norm: 19 (1) eating utensil bedding linen sufficient quantity quality cleanliness shall provided fisherman board (2) cost linen (other bedding) may recovered owner fisherman operational cost provided collective agreement governing share system fisherman concerned fisherman work agreement communication facility

title: powers conferred on me by section 3 of the European Communities Act 1972
heading: 20. Every fisherman on board shall be given reasonable access to
text_raw:
20. Every fisherman on board shall be given reasonable access to 
communication facilities, to the extent practicable, at a reasonable cost and not 
exceeding the full cost to the owner. 

Galley and food storage facilities
text_norm: 20 every fisherman board shall given reasonable access communication facility extent practicable reasonable cost exceeding full cost owner galley food storage facility

title: powers conferred on me by section 3 of the European Communities Act 1972
heading: 21. Containers of butane or propane gas used for cooking purposes in a
text_raw:
21. Containers of butane or propane gas used for cooking purposes in a 
galley shall be kept on the open deck and in a shelter which is designed to 
protect them from external heat sources and external impact. 

Clean and habitable conditions
text_norm: 21 container butane propane gas used cooking purpose galley shall kept open deck shelter designed protect external heat source external impact clean habitable condition

title: powers conferred on me by section 3 of the European Communities Act 1972
heading: 22. (1) Accommodation shall be maintained in a clean and habitable
text_raw:
22. (1) Accommodation shall be maintained in a clean and habitable 
condition and the accommodation shall be kept free of goods and stores which 
are not the personal property of the occupants or for their safety or rescue. 

(2) Galley and food storage facilities shall be maintained in a hygienic 

condition. 

(3) Waste shall be kept in closed, well-sealed containers and removed from 

food handling areas whenever necessary. 

Other facilities
text_norm: 22 (1) accommodation shall maintained clean habitable condition accommodation shall kept free good store personal property occupant safety rescue (2) galley food storage facility shall maintained hygienic condition (3) waste shall kept closed well-sealed container removed food handling area whenever necessary facility

title: powers conferred on me by section 3 of the European Communities Act 1972
heading: 23. A place for hanging foul-weather gear and other personal protective
text_raw:
23. A place for hanging foul-weather gear and other personal protective 

equipment shall be provided outside of, but convenient to, sleeping rooms. 

Provision stores
text_norm: 23 place hanging foul-weather gear personal protective equipment shall provided outside convenient sleeping room provision store

title: powers conferred on me by section 3 of the European Communities Act 1972
heading: 24. A suitable place for provisions shall be provided which has adequate
text_raw:
24. A suitable place for provisions shall be provided which has adequate 
capacity and which can be kept dry, cool and well ventilated in order to avoid 
deterioration of the stores. Refrigerators or other low temperature storage shall 
be used, where possible. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 10 [267] 

Accommodation-decked vessels of 24 metres in length and over 

Part 5 

Application-Part 5
text_norm: 24 suitable place provision shall provided adequate capacity kept dry cool well ventilated order avoid deterioration store refrigerator low temperature storage shall used possible 10 267 accommodation-decked vessel 24 metre length part 5 application-part 5

(b) 

a new fishing vessel of 24 metres in length and over, and 

an existing decked vessel of 24 metres in length and over where 
the accommodation is substantially altered or reconstructed on 
or after 16 November 2017.

heading: 28. Before -

28. Before -

(b) 

the construction of a fishing vessel referred to in Regulation

title: powers conferred on me by section 3 of the European Communities Act 1972
heading: 29. The minimum permitted headroom in all accommodation where full
text_raw:
29. The minimum permitted headroom in all accommodation where full 

and free movement is necessary shall not be less than 200 centimetres. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [267] 11 

Openings into and between accommodation spaces
text_norm: 29 minimum permitted headroom accommodation full free movement necessary shall le 200 centimetre 267 11 opening accommodation space

title: powers conferred on me by section 3 of the European Communities Act 1972
heading: 30. (1) There shall be no direct openings, except for the purposes of
text_raw:
30. (1) There shall be no direct openings, except for the purposes of 
emergency escape, into sleeping rooms from fish rooms and machinery spaces 
or from galleys, storerooms, drying rooms or communal sanitary areas. 

(2) That part of the bulkhead separating such places from sleeping rooms 
and external bulkheads shall be efficiently constructed of steel or another 
approved material and shall be watertight and gas tight. 

(3) Paragraphs (1) and (2) do not exclude the possibility of sanitary areas 

being shared between two cabins. 

Insulation
text_norm: 30 (1) shall direct opening except purpose emergency escape sleeping room fish room machinery space galley storeroom drying room communal sanitary area (2) part bulkhead separating place sleeping room external bulkhead shall efficiently constructed steel another approved material shall watertight gas tight (3) paragraph (1) (2) exclude possibility sanitary area shared two cabin insulation

title: powers conferred on me by section 3 of the European Communities Act 1972
heading: 31. (1) Accommodation spaces shall be adequately insulated.
text_raw:
31. (1) Accommodation spaces shall be adequately insulated. 

(2) The material used to construct internal bulkheads, panelling and 
sheeting, and floors and joinings shall be suitable for the purpose and shall be 
conducive to ensuring a healthy environment. 

(3) Sufficient drainage shall be provided in all accommodation spaces. 

(4) All practicable measures shall be taken to protect accommodation on 
board fishing vessels against flies and other insects, particularly when vessels 
are operating in mosquito-infested areas. 

(5) Emergency escapes from all accommodation spaces shall be provided 

as necessary. 

Ventilation
text_norm: 31 (1) accommodation space shall adequately insulated (2) material used construct internal bulkhead panelling sheeting floor joining shall suitable purpose shall conducive ensuring healthy environment (3) sufficient drainage shall provided accommodation space (4) practicable measure shall taken protect accommodation board fishing vessel fly insect particularly vessel operating mosquito-infested area (5) emergency escape accommodation space shall provided necessary ventilation

title: powers conferred on me by section 3 of the European Communities Act 1972
heading: 32. (1) Accommodation shall be equipped with a system of ventilation
text_raw:
32. (1) Accommodation shall be equipped with a system of ventilation 
which shall be controlled so as to maintain the air in a satisfactory condition 
and to ensure sufficiency of air movement in all weather conditions and 
climates. 

(2) Ventilation systems shall be in operation at all times when fishermen 

are on board. 

(3) Ventilation arrangements or other measures shall be such as to protect 

non-smokers from tobacco smoke. 

Heating and Air Conditioning
text_norm: 32 (1) accommodation shall equipped system ventilation shall controlled maintain air satisfactory condition ensure sufficiency air movement weather condition climate (2) ventilation system shall operation time fisherman board (3) ventilation arrangement measure shall protect non-smokers tobacco smoke heating air conditioning

title: powers conferred on me by section 3 of the European Communities Act 1972
heading: 33. (1) Adequate heat shall be provided, through an appropriate heating
text_raw:
33. (1) Adequate heat shall be provided, through an appropriate heating 

system, except in fishing vessels operating exclusively in tropical climates. 

(2) The system of heating referred to in paragraph (1) shall provide heat in 
all conditions, as necessary, and shall be in operation when fishermen are 
living or working on board and when conditions so require. 

(3) Air conditioning shall be provided in accommodation spaces, the 

bridge, the radio room and any centralised machinery control room. 

 
 
 
 
 12 [267] 

(4) The requirement in paragraph (3) does not apply to vessels regularly 
engaged in areas where temperature climatic conditions do not require air 
conditioning. 

Lighting
text_norm: 33 (1) adequate heat shall provided appropriate heating system except fishing vessel operating exclusively tropical climate (2) system heating referred paragraph (1) shall provide heat condition necessary shall operation fisherman living working board condition require (3) air conditioning shall provided accommodation space bridge radio room centralised machinery control room 12 267 (4) requirement paragraph (3) apply vessel regularly engaged area temperature climatic condition require air conditioning lighting

title: powers conferred on me by section 3 of the European Communities Act 1972
heading: 34. (1) All accommodation spaces shall be provided with adequate light.
text_raw:
34. (1) All accommodation spaces shall be provided with adequate light. 

(2) Where practicable, accommodation spaces shall be lit with natural light 

in addition to artificial light. 

(3) Where sleeping spaces have natural light, a means of blocking the light 

shall be provided. 

(4) Adequate reading light shall be provided for every berth in addition to 

the normal lighting of the sleeping room. 

(5) Emergency lighting shall be provided in sleeping rooms. 

(6) Where the fishing vessel is not fitted with emergency lighting in mess 
rooms, passageways, and any other spaces that are or may be used for 
emergency escape, permanent night lighting shall be provided in such spaces. 

(7) In any part of the accommodation space available for free movement, 
the minimum standard for lighting shall be such as to permit a person with 
normal vision to read an ordinary printed newspaper on a clear day. 

Sleeping Rooms 

General
text_norm: 34 (1) accommodation space shall provided adequate light (2) practicable accommodation space shall lit natural light addition artificial light (3) sleeping space natural light mean blocking light shall provided (4) adequate reading light shall provided every berth addition normal lighting sleeping room (5) emergency lighting shall provided sleeping room (6) fishing vessel fitted emergency lighting mess room passageway space may used emergency escape permanent night lighting shall provided space (7) part accommodation space available free movement minimum standard lighting shall permit person normal vision read ordinary printed newspaper clear day sleeping room general

title: powers conferred on me by section 3 of the European Communities Act 1972
heading: 35. Where the design, dimensions and purpose of the vessel allow, the
text_raw:
35. Where the design, dimensions and purpose of the vessel allow, the 
sleeping accommodation shall be located so as to minimise the effects of 
motion and acceleration but shall in no case be located forward of the collision 
bulkhead. 

Floor Area
text_norm: 35 design dimension purpose vessel allow sleeping accommodation shall located minimise effect motion acceleration shall case located forward collision bulkhead floor area

title: powers conferred on me by section 3 of the European Communities Act 1972
heading: 36. (1) For vessels of 24 metres in length and over but which are less than
text_raw:
36. (1) For vessels of 24 metres in length and over but which are less than 
45 metres in length, the floor area per person of sleeping rooms, excluding 
space occupied by berths and lockers, shall not be less than 1.5 square metres. 

(2) For vessels of 45 metres in length and over, the floor area per person of 
sleeping rooms, excluding space occupied for berths and lockers, shall not be 
less than 2 square metres. 

Persons per sleeping rooms
text_norm: 36 (1) vessel 24 metre length le 45 metre length floor area per person sleeping room excluding space occupied berth locker shall le 1.5 square metre (2) vessel 45 metre length floor area per person sleeping room excluding space occupied berth locker shall le 2 square metre person per sleeping room

title: powers conferred on me by section 3 of the European Communities Act 1972
heading: 37. (1) The number of persons allowed to occupy each sleeping room shall
text_raw:
37. (1) The number of persons allowed to occupy each sleeping room shall 

not be more than four. 

(2) Sleeping rooms for officers shall be for one person wherever possible 

and in no case shall the sleeping room contain more than two berths. 

 
 
 
 
 
 [267] 13 

(3) An owner may apply to the competent authority for an exemption from 
the requirement to comply with paragraph (1) or paragraph (2), as the case may 
be, in respect of his or her fishing vessel. 

(4) An application under paragraph (3) shall be made in writing and shall 
state the reason why, in the opinion of the owner, having regard to the size, 
type or intended service of the fishing vessel concerned, the grant of an 
exemption is required. 

(5) Upon receipt of an application made in accordance with paragraph (4), 
the competent authority may, if it is satisfied that the size, type or intended 
service of the fishing vessel would make the requirement set out in paragraph 
(1) or the requirements set out in paragraph (2) unreasonable or impracticable 
to comply with in respect of the fishing vessel concerned, grant an exemption 
from the requirement to comply with paragraph (1) or (2), as the case may be. 

(6) The competent authority shall notify the owner in writing of its decision 

and the notice shall specify the reasons for that decision. 

(7) Where the competent authority grants an exemption under paragraph 

(5) the notice shall specify - 

(a) 

the date on which it takes effect, and 

(b) 

the terms on which the exemption is granted. 

(8) On giving reasonable notice to the owner, the competent authority may 

- 

(a) where it considers that the terms on which the exemption was 

granted are not being complied with, or 

(b) 

for reasons concerning the protection of the health or safety of 
the fishermen on board, 

revoke an exemption granted under paragraph (5) and the notice shall specify 
the reasons for that decision. 

Persons per sleeping rooms 

Other
text_norm: 37 (1) number person allowed occupy sleeping room shall four (2) sleeping room officer shall one person wherever possible case shall sleeping room contain two berth 267 13 (3) owner may apply competent authority exemption requirement comply paragraph (1) paragraph (2) case may respect fishing vessel (4) application paragraph (3) shall made writing shall state reason opinion owner regard size type intended service fishing vessel concerned grant exemption required (5) upon receipt application made accordance paragraph (4) competent authority may satisfied size type intended service fishing vessel would make requirement set paragraph (1) requirement set paragraph (2) unreasonable impracticable comply respect fishing vessel concerned grant exemption requirement comply paragraph (1) (2) case may be (6) competent authority shall notify owner writing decision notice shall specify reason decision (7) competent authority grant exemption paragraph (5) notice shall specify - (a) date take effect (b) term exemption granted (8) giving reasonable notice owner competent authority may - (a) considers term exemption granted complied (b) reason concerning protection health safety fisherman board revoke exemption granted paragraph (5) notice shall specify reason decision person per sleeping room

title: powers conferred on me by section 3 of the European Communities Act 1972
heading: 38. (1) The maximum number of persons to be accommodated in any
text_raw:
38. (1) The maximum number of persons to be accommodated in any 
sleeping room shall be legibly and indelibly marked in a place in the room 
where it can be conveniently seen. 

(2) Individual berths, the minimum inside dimensions of which shall not be 

less than 198 by 80 centimetres, shall be provided. 

(3) The mattresses shall be of a suitable material. 

(4) Local lighting shall be provided in each berth. 

(5) Sleeping rooms shall be planned and equipped so as to ensure 

reasonable comfort for the occupants and to facilitate tidiness. 

 
 
 
 14 [267] 

(6) Equipment provided shall include berths, individual lockers sufficient 
for clothing and other personal effects, and a desk suitable for writing, with a 
chair. 

(7) Sleeping accommodation shall be situated or equipped, as practicable, 

so as to provide appropriate levels of privacy for men and women. 

Mess Rooms
text_norm: 38 (1) maximum number person accommodated sleeping room shall legibly indelibly marked place room conveniently seen (2) individual berth minimum inside dimension shall le 198 80 centimetre shall provided (3) mattress shall suitable material (4) local lighting shall provided berth (5) sleeping room shall planned equipped ensure reasonable comfort occupant facilitate tidiness 14 267 (6) equipment provided shall include berth individual locker sufficient clothing personal effect desk suitable writing chair (7) sleeping accommodation shall situated equipped practicable provide appropriate level privacy men woman mess room

title: powers conferred on me by section 3 of the European Communities Act 1972
heading: 39. (1) Mess rooms shall be as close as possible to the galley, but in no
text_raw:
39. (1) Mess rooms shall be as close as possible to the galley, but in no 

case shall a mess room be located forward of the collision bulkhead. 

(2) Mess room accommodation shall be separate from sleeping quarters. 

(3) The dimensions and equipment of each mess room shall be sufficient 

for the number of persons likely to use it at any one time. 

(4) A refrigerator of sufficient capacity and facilities for making hot and 

cold drinks shall be available and accessible to fishermen at all times. 

Tubs or Showers, Toilets and Washbasins
text_norm: 39 (1) mess room shall close possible galley case shall mess room located forward collision bulkhead (2) mess room accommodation shall separate sleeping quarter (3) dimension equipment mess room shall sufficient number person likely use one time (4) refrigerator sufficient capacity facility making hot cold drink shall available accessible fisherman time tub shower toilet washbasin

title: powers conferred on me by section 3 of the European Communities Act 1972
heading: 40. (1) Sanitary facilities, which include toilets, washbasins and tubs or
text_raw:
40. (1) Sanitary facilities, which include toilets, washbasins and tubs or 
showers, shall be provided for all persons on board, as appropriate for the 
service of the vessel. 

(2) The facilities referred to in paragraph (1) shall meet at least minimum 

standards of health and hygiene and reasonable standards of quality. 

(3) The sanitary accommodation shall be such as 

to eliminate 

contamination of other spaces. 

(4) The sanitary facilities shall allow for reasonable privacy. 

(5) Hot and cold running fresh water shall be available to all fishermen and 

other persons on board in sufficient quantities to allow for proper hygiene. 

(6) Sanitary facilities shall be fitted with ventilation to the open air, 

independent of any other part of the accommodation. 

(7) All surfaces in sanitary accommodation shall be such as to facilitate 

easy and effective cleaning. 

(8) Floors in sanitary accommodation shall have a non-slip deck covering. 

(9) For all fishermen who do not occupy rooms to which sanitary facilities 
are attached, there shall be provided at least one tub or shower or both, one 
toilet and one washbasin for every four persons or fewer. 

Laundry Facilities
text_norm: 40 (1) sanitary facility include toilet washbasin tub shower shall provided person board appropriate service vessel (2) facility referred paragraph (1) shall meet least minimum standard health hygiene reasonable standard quality (3) sanitary accommodation shall eliminate contamination space (4) sanitary facility shall allow reasonable privacy (5) hot cold running fresh water shall available fisherman person board sufficient quantity allow proper hygiene (6) sanitary facility shall fitted ventilation open air independent part accommodation (7) surface sanitary accommodation shall facilitate easy effective cleaning (8) floor sanitary accommodation shall non-slip deck covering (9) fisherman occupy room sanitary facility attached shall provided least one tub shower one toilet one washbasin every four person fewer laundry facility

title: powers conferred on me by section 3 of the European Communities Act 1972
heading: 41. (1) Adequate facilities for washing, drying and ironing clothes shall be
text_raw:
41. (1) Adequate facilities for washing, drying and ironing clothes shall be 

provided. 

(2) For vessels of 45 metres in length and over, adequate facilities for 
washing, drying and ironing clothes shall be provided in a compartment 

 
 
 
 
 separate from sleeping rooms, mess rooms and toilets and shall be adequately 
ventilated, heated and equipped with lines or other means for drying clothes. 

[267] 15 

Other Facilities 

A place for hanging foul-weather gear and other personal protective
text_norm: 41 (1) adequate facility washing drying ironing clothes shall provided (2) vessel 45 metre length adequate facility washing drying ironing clothes shall provided compartment separate sleeping room mess room toilet shall adequately ventilated heated equipped line mean drying clothes 267 15 facility place hanging foul-weather gear personal protective

title: powers conferred on me by section 3 of the European Communities Act 1972
heading: equipment shall be provided outside of, but convenient to, sleeping rooms.
text_raw:
42. 
equipment shall be provided outside of, but convenient to, sleeping rooms. 

Bedding, Mess Utensils and Miscellaneous Provisions
text_norm: 42 equipment shall provided outside convenient sleeping room bedding mess utensil miscellaneous provision

title: powers conferred on me by section 3 of the European Communities Act 1972
heading: (a) Eating utensils, bedding and other linen that are of sufficient
text_raw:
43. 

(a) Eating utensils, bedding and other linen that are of sufficient 
quality, quantity and cleanliness shall be provided to all 
fishermen on board. 

(b) The cost of linen (other than bedding) may be recovered by the 
owner from a fisherman as an operational cost where this is 
provided for in a collective agreement governing the share 
system of the fisherman concerned or in the fisherman’s work 
agreement. 

Recreational Facilities
text_norm: 43 (a) eating utensil bedding linen sufficient quality quantity cleanliness shall provided fisherman board (b) cost linen (other bedding) may recovered owner fisherman operational cost provided collective agreement governing share system fisherman concerned fisherman work agreement recreational facility

title: powers conferred on me by section 3 of the European Communities Act 1972
heading: 44. (1) Appropriate recreational facilities, amenities and services shall be
text_raw:
44. (1) Appropriate recreational facilities, amenities and services shall be 

provided for all fishermen on board. 

(2) Where appropriate, mess rooms may be used for recreational activities. 

Communication Facilities
text_norm: 44 (1) appropriate recreational facility amenity service shall provided fisherman board (2) appropriate mess room may used recreational activity communication facility

title: powers conferred on me by section 3 of the European Communities Act 1972
heading: 45. Every fisherman on board shall be given reasonable access to
text_raw:
45. Every fisherman on board shall be given reasonable access to 
communications facilities to the extent practicable and at a reasonable cost that 
does not exceed the cost to the owner. 

Galley and Food Storage Facilities
text_norm: 45 every fisherman board shall given reasonable access communication facility extent practicable reasonable cost exceed cost owner galley food storage facility

title: powers conferred on me by section 3 of the European Communities Act 1972
heading: 46. (1) There shall be a separate galley.
text_raw:
46. (1) There shall be a separate galley. 

(2) The galley shall be of adequate size for its purpose and it shall be well-

lit and ventilated, and properly equipped and maintained. 

(3) Containers of butane or propane gas used for cooking purposes in a 
galley shall be kept on the open deck and in a shelter which is designed to 
protect them from external heat sources and external impact. 

(4) A suitable place that has adequate capacity which can be kept dry, cool 
and well ventilated in order to avoid deterioration of stores shall be provided 
for provisions. Refrigerators or other low temperature storage shall be used, 
where possible. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 16 [267] 

Clean and Habitable Conditions
text_norm: 46 (1) shall separate galley (2) galley shall adequate size purpose shall well- lit ventilated properly equipped maintained (3) container butane propane gas used cooking purpose galley shall kept open deck shelter designed protect external heat source external impact (4) suitable place adequate capacity kept dry cool well ventilated order avoid deterioration store shall provided provision refrigerator low temperature storage shall used possible 16 267 clean habitable condition

title: powers conferred on me by section 3 of the European Communities Act 1972
heading: 47. (1) Accommodation shall be maintained in a clean and habitable
text_raw:
47. (1) Accommodation shall be maintained in a clean and habitable 
condition and the accommodation shall be kept free of goods and stores which 
are not the personal property of the occupants or for their safety or rescue. 

(2) Galley and food storage facilities shall be maintained in a hygienic 

condition. 

(3) Waste shall be kept in closed, well-sealed containers and removed from 

food handling areas whenever necessary. 

Inspections by master
text_norm: 47 (1) accommodation shall maintained clean habitable condition accommodation shall kept free good store personal property occupant safety rescue (2) galley food storage facility shall maintained hygienic condition (3) waste shall kept closed well-sealed container removed food handling area whenever necessary inspection master

title: powers conferred on me by section 3 of the European Communities Act 1972
heading: 48. (1) The master shall carry out weekly inspections to ensure that -
text_raw:
48. (1) The master shall carry out weekly inspections to ensure that - 

(a) 

the accommodation on board the fishing vessel is clean, 
decently habitable and safe and is maintained in a good state of 
repair, 

(b) 

food and water supplies are sufficient, and 

(c) 

galley and food storage spaces and equipment are hygienic and 
in a proper state of repair. 

(2) The master shall record the results of an inspection carried out under 
paragraph (1) and, where the inspection found deficiencies in the requirements 
of paragraph (1)(a), (b) or (c), the record shall detail the actions taken to 
address those deficiencies. 

(3) The owner shall - 

(a) 

retain the record of the results of an inspection referred to in 
paragraph (2) for a period of at least one year from the date of 
the inspection, and 

(b) 

ensure that the record is made available for inspection by an 
authorised officer. 

PART 6 

Dispute resolution procedure 

Dispute resolution procedure
text_norm: 48 (1) master shall carry weekly inspection ensure - (a) accommodation board fishing vessel clean decently habitable safe maintained good state repair (b) food water supply sufficient (c) galley food storage space equipment hygienic proper state repair (2) master shall record result inspection carried paragraph (1) inspection found deficiency requirement paragraph (1)(a) (b) (c) record shall detail action taken address deficiency (3) owner shall - (a) retain record result inspection referred paragraph (2) period least one year date inspection (b) ensure record made available inspection authorised officer part 6 dispute resolution procedure dispute resolution procedure

title: powers conferred on me by section 3 of the European Communities Act 1972
heading: 49. (1) The owner shall ensure that there is available to a fisherman on that
text_raw:
49. (1) The owner shall ensure that there is available to a fisherman on that 
fishing vessel a procedure (in this Regulation referred to as a “dispute 
resolution procedure”) for submitting a complaint concerning accommodation 
that does not meet the requirements of these Regulations and, where 
applicable, the requirements referred to in paragraph (7), and for resolving 
fairly, effectively and expeditiously any disputes arising from the complaint. 

(2) The dispute resolution procedure shall - 

(a) 

seek to have the matter resolved on board the fishing vessel, 

 
 
 
 
 [267] 17 

(b) 

(c) 

enable the fisherman to make a complaint directly to the owner, 
the master or the competent authority, and 

include the right of a fisherman to be accompanied or 
represented during the course of the procedure. 

(3) The owner shall ensure that a fisherman joining the fishing vessel has 

been provided with - 

(a) 

a copy of the dispute resolution procedure, and 

(b) 

the contact information for the competent authority. 

(4) A fisherman may make a complaint to the competent authority alleging 
a breach of the requirements of these Regulations or, where applicable, the 
requirements referred to in paragraph (7) and the competent authority shall 
treat the source of the information provided in the complaint as confidential. 

(5) On receipt of a complaint under paragraph (4) the competent authority 

may nominate an authorised officer to investigate the complaint. 

(6) An authorised officer nominated by the competent authority under 
paragraph (5) may, without prejudice to his or her powers under Regulation 
50(2), while the fishing vessel concerned is in the State - 

(a) board the fishing vessel for the purposes of investigating a 

complaint made under paragraph (4), and 

(b) 

facilitate negotiations between the fisherman and the owner or 
the master, as appropriate, for the purposes of resolving the 
complaint. 

(7) A complaint made under the dispute resolution procedure or made to 

the competent authority under paragraph (4) may - 

(a) 

(b) 

in respect of accommodation on a fishing vessel to which Part 4 
applies, include a complaint that the accommodation does not 
meet the accommodation requirements that are applicable to 
such a vessel under the Regulations of 2007, and 

in respect of accommodation on a fishing vessel to which Part 5 
applies, include a complaint that the accommodation does not 
meet the accommodation requirements that are applicable to 
such a vessel under Schedule 1 to the Regulations of 1999. 

(8) Nothing in this Regulation shall affect any right of complaint or redress 

that a fisherman has other than under this Regulation. 

PART 7 

Enforcement 

Authorised officers

title: powers conferred on me by section 3 of the European Communities Act 1972
heading: 50. (1) A person appointed as a surveyor of ships under section 724 of the
text_raw:
50. (1) A person appointed as a surveyor of ships under section 724 of the 
Merchant Shipping Act 1894 (c. 60) shall be an authorised officer for the 
purposes of these Regulations. 

 
 
 
 18 [267] 

(2) For the purposes of ensuring compliance with these Regulations, an 

authorised officer may do any of the following: 

(a) 

(b) 

(c) 

(d) 

at all reasonable times board any fishing vessel while the vessel 
is in the State; 

search and inspect the fishing vessel and any documents or 
records found on board; 

require any person on board the fishing vessel to give him or her 
such assistance and information and to produce to the authorised 
officer any report, document or record (including, in the case of 
information in a non-legible form, a copy of the information, or 
of extracts from it, in permanent legible form) as he or she may 
reasonably require for the purposes of his or her functions under 
these Regulations; 

inspect, examine and take copies, or extracts from, or take away, 
if necessary, for the purposes of inspection or examination, any 
report, document or record (including in the case of information 
in non-legible form, a copy of the information, or of extracts 
from it, in permanent legible form) that the authorised officer 
finds in the course of his or her inspection and require the 
person by whom such report, document or record is kept or who 
produced the report, document or record to certify the copy as a 
true copy; 

(e) 

detain a fishing vessel in accordance with Regulation 51. 

(3) Where he or she considers it necessary, an authorised officer may be 
accompanied by a member of the Garda Síochána when exercising any powers 
conferred on him or her by these Regulations. 

Notice of detention
text_norm: 50 (1) person appointed surveyor ship section 724 merchant shipping act 1894 (c 60) shall authorised officer purpose regulation 18 267 (2) purpose ensuring compliance regulation authorised officer may following (a) (b) (c) (d) reasonable time board fishing vessel vessel state search inspect fishing vessel document record found board require person board fishing vessel give assistance information produce authorised officer report document record (including case information non-legible form copy information extract permanent legible form) may reasonably require purpose function regulation inspect examine take copy extract take away necessary purpose inspection examination report document record (including case information non-legible form copy information extract permanent legible form) authorised officer find course inspection require person report document record kept produced report document record certify copy true copy (e) detain fishing vessel accordance regulation 51 (3) considers necessary authorised officer may accompanied member garda siochana exercising power conferred regulation notice detention

title: powers conferred on me by section 3 of the European Communities Act 1972
heading: 51. (1) An authorised officer may detain a fishing vessel in a port in the
text_raw:
51. (1) An authorised officer may detain a fishing vessel in a port in the 

State where he or she is of the opinion that - 

(a) 

(b) 

there has been a failure to comply with the requirements of these 
Regulations, and 

the detention of the vessel is necessary for the protection of the 
health and safety of the fishermen on board the vessel. 

(2) Where a fishing vessel has been detained under paragraph (1), the 
competent authority shall serve a notice (in these Regulations referred to as a 
“notice of detention”) on the master of the fishing vessel concerned. 

(3) A notice of detention shall - 

(a) 

(b) 

state the grounds upon which the fishing vessel is detained, 

identify the provision of these Regulations that has not been or 
is not being complied with by the person, 

 
 
 [267] 19 

(c) 

(d) 

(e) 

(f) 

specify the action to be taken before the notice of detention will 
be withdrawn and, where appropriate, the period within which 
that action shall be taken, 

inform the person of the requirement to confirm compliance 
with the notice of detention under paragraph (4), 

inform the person of the right to appeal the notice of detention in 
accordance with Regulation 53, 

state that a failure to comply with the notice of detention is an 
offence under Regulation 55, and 

(g) be signed and dated by the competent authority. 

(4) A person on whom a notice of detention has been served who is of the 
opinion that the notice of detention has been complied with shall confirm such 
compliance in writing to the competent authority. 

(5) Where a person confirms compliance under paragraph (4), the 
competent authority shall, on being satisfied that the person has so complied, 
by notice in writing to the person, withdraw the notice of detention. 

(6) The competent authority may, where it considers it appropriate to do so, 
by notice in writing to the person on whom a notice of detention was served, 
withdraw the notice of detention. 

(7) A person on whom a notice of detention has been served may appeal 

the notice in accordance with Regulation 53. 

Directions
text_norm: 51 (1) authorised officer may detain fishing vessel port state opinion - (a) (b) failure comply requirement regulation detention vessel necessary protection health safety fisherman board vessel (2) fishing vessel detained paragraph (1) competent authority shall serve notice (in regulation referred notice detention ) master fishing vessel concerned (3) notice detention shall - (a) (b) state ground upon fishing vessel detained identify provision regulation complied person 267 19 (c) (d) (e) (f) specify action taken notice detention withdrawn appropriate period within action shall taken inform person requirement confirm compliance notice detention paragraph (4) inform person right appeal notice detention accordance regulation 53 state failure comply notice detention offence regulation 55 (g) signed dated competent authority (4) person notice detention served opinion notice detention complied shall confirm compliance writing competent authority (5) person confirms compliance paragraph (4) competent authority shall satisfied person complied notice writing person withdraw notice detention (6) competent authority may considers appropriate notice writing person notice detention served withdraw notice detention (7) person notice detention served may appeal notice accordance regulation 53 direction

title: powers conferred on me by section 3 of the European Communities Act 1972
heading: 52. (1) Where the competent authority considers that the owner or the
text_raw:
52. (1) Where the competent authority considers that the owner or the 
master is failing to comply with these Regulations the competent authority may 
serve a direction (in these Regulations referred to as a “direction”) on that 
person. 

(2) A person on whom a direction is served under paragraph (1) may, 
within 14 days of the service of the direction, make representations in writing 
to the competent authority in relation to the direction. 

(3) Any representations made under paragraph (2) shall be considered by 
the competent authority in deciding to confirm, modify or withdraw the 
direction. 

(4) The competent authority may, where it considers it appropriate to do so, 
by notice in writing to the person on whom a direction was served, confirm, 
modify or withdraw the direction. 

(5) A direction shall - 

(a) 

(b) 

state the grounds upon which the direction is made, 

identify the provision of these Regulations that has not been or 
is not being complied with by the person, 

 
 
 20 [267] 

(c) 

(d) 

(e) 

(f) 

specify the action to be taken by the person on whom the 
direction is served and, where appropriate, the period within 
which that action shall be taken, 

inform the person of the requirement to confirm compliance 
with the direction under paragraph (7), 

inform the person of the right to appeal the direction in 
accordance with Regulation 53, 

state that a failure to comply with the direction is an offence 
under Regulation 55, and 

(g) be signed and dated by the competent authority. 

(6) A direction shall be complied with within such period as may be 

specified in the direction. 

(7) A person on whom a direction has been served, who is of the opinion 
that the direction has been complied with, shall confirm such compliance in 
writing to the competent authority as soon as practicable after so complying. 

(8) Where a person confirms compliance under paragraph (7), the 
competent authority shall, on being satisfied that the person has so complied, 
give notice to the person confirming that compliance. 

(9) A person on whom a direction has been served may appeal the direction 

in accordance with Regulation 53. 

Appeals
text_norm: 52 (1) competent authority considers owner master failing comply regulation competent authority may serve direction (in regulation referred direction ) person (2) person direction served paragraph (1) may within 14 day service direction make representation writing competent authority relation direction (3) representation made paragraph (2) shall considered competent authority deciding confirm modify withdraw direction (4) competent authority may considers appropriate notice writing person direction served confirm modify withdraw direction (5) direction shall - (a) (b) state ground upon direction made identify provision regulation complied person 20 267 (c) (d) (e) (f) specify action taken person direction served appropriate period within action shall taken inform person requirement confirm compliance direction paragraph (7) inform person right appeal direction accordance regulation 53 state failure comply direction offence regulation 55 (g) signed dated competent authority (6) direction shall complied within period may specified direction (7) person direction served opinion direction complied shall confirm compliance writing competent authority soon practicable complying (8) person confirms compliance paragraph (7) competent authority shall satisfied person complied give notice person confirming compliance (9) person direction served may appeal direction accordance regulation 53 appeal

title: powers conferred on me by section 3 of the European Communities Act 1972
heading: 53. (1) A person aggrieved by a notice of detention or a direction may
text_raw:
53. (1) A person aggrieved by a notice of detention or a direction may 

appeal against - 

(a) 

(b) 

the notice of detention, to a judge of the District Court in whose 
district the fishing vessel has been detained, or 

the direction, to a judge of the District Court in whose district 
the person ordinarily resides or carries on business. 

(2) An appeal may be made not later than 21 days from the date - 

(a) 

(b) 

the notice of detention was served under Regulation 51(2), or 

the direction - 

(i) was served under Regulation 52(1), or 

(ii) was confirmed or modified under Regulation 52(4). 

(3) A copy of the notice of appeal shall be given by the person making an 
appeal to the competent authority not less than 48 hours before the hearing of 
the appeal and the competent authority shall be entitled to appear, be heard and 
adduce evidence on the hearing of the appeal and at the hearing of any 
application referred to in paragraph (4). 

(4) The bringing of an appeal shall not have the effect of suspending the 
operation of the notice of detention or the direction, as the case may be, but the 

 
 
 [267] 21 

District Court may, on application to it by the appellant, suspend its operation 
until the appeal is determined or withdrawn. 

(5) On the hearing of an appeal under this Regulation, the District Court 
may confirm, vary or revoke the notice of detention or the direction as the case 
may be. 

Service of documents

title: powers conferred on me by section 3 of the European Communities Act 1972
heading: 54. (1) A direction, or notice of detention or other document that is
text_raw:
54. (1) A direction, or notice of detention or other document that is 
required to be given to or served on a person under these Regulations shall be 
addressed to the person concerned by name and may be given to or served on 
the person in one of the following ways - 

(a) by delivering it to the person, 

(b) by leaving it at the address at which the person ordinarily resides 
or carries on business or, in a case in which an address for 
service has been given, at that address, 

(c) 

by sending it by post in a prepaid registered letter to the person 
at the address at which the person ordinarily resides or carries on 
business or, in a case in which an address for service has been 
given, to that address, or 

(d) by electronic means, in a case in which the person has given 
notice in writing to the person serving or giving the direction, 
notice or document concerned of his or her consent to the 
direction, notice or document (or documents of a class to which 
the direction, notice or document belongs) being served on, or 
given to, him or her in that manner. 

(2) For the purpose of these Regulations, a company registered under the 
Companies Acts is deemed to be ordinarily resident at its registered office, and 
every other body corporate and every unincorporated body of persons shall be 
deemed to be ordinarily resident at its principal office or place of business. 

(3) Where an opinion, finding, statement or decision of the competent 

authority is contained in a document which - 

(a) 

(b) 

is purported to have been made by or at the direction of the 
competent authority, and 

is produced in evidence by an authorised officer in any 
proceedings, 

the document shall be evidence of any such opinion, finding, statement or 
decision in such proceedings without further proof. 

Offences and Penalties
text_norm: 54 (1) direction notice detention document required given served person regulation shall addressed person concerned name may given served person one following way - (a) delivering person (b) leaving address person ordinarily resides carry business case address service given address (c) sending post prepaid registered letter person address person ordinarily resides carry business case address service given address (d) electronic mean case person given notice writing person serving giving direction notice document concerned consent direction notice document (or document class direction notice document belongs) served given manner (2) purpose regulation company registered company act deemed ordinarily resident registered office every body corporate every unincorporated body person shall deemed ordinarily resident principal office place business (3) opinion finding statement decision competent authority contained document - (a) (b) purported made direction competent authority produced evidence authorised officer proceeding document shall evidence opinion finding statement decision proceeding without proof offence penalty

title: powers conferred on me by section 3 of the European Communities Act 1972
heading: 55. (1) An owner shall be guilty of an offence where he or she fails to
text_raw:
55. (1) An owner shall be guilty of an offence where he or she fails to 

comply with Regulation 7(2), 8(2), 13, 28, 48(3) or 49(3). 

 
 
 
 
 22 [267] 

(2) A person shall be guilty of an offence where he or she fails to comply 

with a direction served on him or her under Regulation 52. 

(3) A master shall be guilty of an offence where he or she fails to comply 
with Regulation 48(2) or a notice of detention served on him or her under 
Regulation 51. 

(4) A person shall be guilty of an offence where he or she - 

(a) prevents, obstructs, impedes or delays an authorised officer in 
the performance of his or her functions under these Regulations, 

(b) 

(c) 

fails to comply with a requirement or request of an authorised 
officer under Regulation 50, or 

gives to an authorised officer any information which is false or 
misleading in any material respect, knowing it to be so false or 
misleading. 

(5) A person guilty of an offence under paragraph (1), (2), (3) or (4) shall 

be liable on summary conviction to a class A fine. 

(6) Where an offence under these Regulations is committed by a body 
corporate and is proved to have been so committed with the consent or 
connivance of or to be attributable to any neglect on the part of any person, 
being a director, manager, secretary, or other officer of the body corporate, or a 
person who was purporting to act in such capacity, that person shall, as well as 
the body corporate, be guilty of an offence and shall be liable to be proceeded 
against and punished as if he or she were guilty of the first-mentioned offence. 

(7) Summary proceedings for an offence under these Regulations may be 

brought and prosecuted by the Minister. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

28 July, 2020. 

EAMON RYAN, 

Minister for Transport, Tourism 
and Sport. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [267] 23

title: powers conferred on me by section 3 of the European Communities Act 1972
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These Regulations implement the provisions of Articles 3, 21, 22, 23, 24 and 
25 and Annex II of the Annex to Council Directive 2017/159 (EU) 
implementing the Agreement concerning the implementation of the Work in 
Fishing Convention, 2007 of the International Labour Organisation, concluded 
on 21 May 2012 between the General Confederation of Agricultural 
Cooperatives in the European Union (Cogeca), the European Transport 
Workers' Federation (ETF) and the Association of National Organisations of 
Fishing Enterprises in the European Union (Europêche). 

In particular, these Regulations place an onus on the master to ensure that the 
food and water carried and served on board fishing vessels is suitable and 
sufficient in terms of quality and quantity. They also place an onus on the 
owner of the vessel to ensure that the standard of accommodation on both new 
and existing fishing vessels, as well as fishing vessels which have been 
substantially altered or reconstructed on or after 16 November 2017, meet the 
requirements of these Regulations. They require that where a fishing vessel 
has changed the flag it flies on or after 16 November 2017 to the flag of the 
State, the accommodation on the fishing vessel shall meet the requirements of 
Regulations. They also require that before the construction of a fishing vessel 
covered by these Regulations, commences, or the accommodation of an 
existing vessel is substantially altered or reconstructed, detailed plans regarding 
the proposed accommodation must be submitted to the competent authority for 
approval. They also provide fishers with a means of submitting a complaint 
concerning accommodation that does not meet the requirements of these 
Regulations. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 24 [267]

ARNA FHOILSIÚ AG OIFIG AN tSOLÁTHAIR
